Line 1: Line 1:   +
{{non-free}}
The phrase '''Wonder Horses''' refers to the [[Horse|equine]] companions of [[Cowboy|cowboy]] heroes in early [[Westerns|Western films]]. What makes these horses different from others that have appeared on the silver screen is their rise from trusty steed to a genuine screen personality. There have been a number of horses who have enjoyed such fame, often receiving equal or second [[Billing_(filmmaking)|billing]] with their human costars.
The phrase '''Wonder Horses''' refers to the [[Horse|equine]] companions of [[Cowboy|cowboy]] heroes in early [[Westerns|Western films]]. What makes these horses different from others that have appeared on the silver screen is their rise from trusty steed to a genuine screen personality. There have been a number of horses who have enjoyed such fame, often receiving equal or second [[Billing_(filmmaking)|billing]] with their human costars.
